body.p:
Mt vernon March 12 64
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette

Your undersigned petitioner would respectfully State that Liberty Longford was indited in the Rockcastle Circuit Court for erecting a fince across the Public highway (a county road) and at the present March Term of Said court 1864 was fined one hundred & sixty two dollars.

The facts of the case were about as ^follows^ the road run through the lands of said Langford and he chainged said road for a small distance not exceeding 150 yards in lenth, thereby considerable shortning the distance and placing the road on the old tract orriginally establised by the County Court, but which having bein obstructed with fallen timbers, was discoontinued for several years and another way opened by the ovesreer and the said Langford believing that the old way was the best way and suiting his conveinence to the chainge it back on accont of the convenience of his farming opperation, did proced to clear off all the obstruction out of the old tract, and make it agood road, with no inconveinenve resulting to the public by the chainge he then went to the overseer and and he accepted the chainge &
and recovered the new road as opened by Langford, he then fenced up the old road Said Langford an industrous & honest man a good farmer and has a large family to support we believe that he had no intention of violating the law and that he did no damage to the Public in removing charging the tract of the road that small distance and considering it a verry great harship for him to pay it we most ernestly ask that the fine be remitted

Jack Adams
H. Carpenter
R. S. Myers, one of the Jury
O. Adams
David N. Williams
Richard Singleton
B. K. Bethurum Judge of B C C
W Stegall
M. J. Miller
D G Colyer
M. A. Brown
John D Pursell
Uriah Albright
John French
H. R. Moore
Wm McClure S R C
E T. Fish C. R. C. C

Refused
Remitted except fess & costsfused
Tho E Bramlette
